page.title: 12Legends & Stories,Whitby 1.
page.content: Whilst visiting Whitby,{Bram Stoker} wrote the famous horror story of{ {"Dracula."}He used parts of the town as locations in his book. Visitors to Whitby can follow the{Dracula Trail.} The evil Count arrived by sea on a shipwrecked schooner which collided with{Tate Hill Pier.}He jumped ashore in the form of a black dog and raced up to{St.Mary's Churchyard.}He changed into a bat and later flew to the south of England! A passing{pirate}was once said to have stolen the Abbey Bells. When his ship was wrecked off{Black Nab,}all were lost and the bells sank to the bottom of the sea. If you shout your lover's name aloud from the cliff top on{Halloween}you may hear the bells ring! This means your love is true and you will hear your wedding bells within a year.
